body_html:
@peterjc123
I tried it with x64 Native Tools Command Prompt for VS 2017 and with CUDA 9 with your updated tutorial.
After compiling for 20 minutes I got the following errors and LOTS OF WARNINGS.

Most of the warnings were like this:
C:/Users/Alex/aaapy/pytorch/aten/src/THC\THCNumerics.cuh(118): warning C4244: 'argument': conversion from 'int64_t' to 'long', possible loss of data [C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]

And then the errors:

"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
(CustomBuild target) ->
  C:/Users/Alex/aaapy/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/cuda/NativeFunctionsCuda.cu(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include fi
le: 'ATen/NativeFunctions.h': No such file or directory [C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxp
roj]

    4054 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)

and:

"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\shm.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
(ClCompile target) ->
  C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\libshm_windows\core.cpp(5): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'TH/TH.h':
No such file or directory [C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\shm.vcxproj]

    0 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)

and then at the end:
error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'torch/lib/tmp_install/share/ATen/Declarations.yaml'

Maybe this is the cause?

CMake Warning:
  Manually-specified variables were not used by the project:

    ATEN_LIBRARIES
    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE
    CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS
    CUDA_NVCC_FLAGS
    NO_CUDA
    THCS_LIBRARIES
    THCUNN_LIBRARIES
    THCUNN_SO_VERSION
    THC_LIBRARIES
    THC_SO_VERSION
    THNN_LIBRARIES
    THNN_SO_VERSION
    THS_LIBRARIES
    TH_INCLUDE_PATH
    TH_LIBRARIES
    TH_LIB_PATH
    TH_SO_VERSION
    Torch_FOUND
    cwrap_files

body:
@peterjc123 
I tried it with x64 Native Tools Command Prompt for VS 2017 and with CUDA 9 with your updated tutorial.
After compiling for 20 minutes I got the following errors and LOTS OF WARNINGS.

Most of the warnings were like this:
`C:/Users/Alex/aaapy/pytorch/aten/src/THC\THCNumerics.cuh(118): warning C4244: 'argument': conversion from 'int64_t' to 'long', possible loss of data [C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj]
`


And then the errors:
```
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
(CustomBuild target) ->
  C:/Users/Alex/aaapy/pytorch/aten/src/ATen/native/cuda/NativeFunctionsCuda.cu(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include fi
le: 'ATen/NativeFunctions.h': No such file or directory [C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\ATen\src\ATen\ATen.vcxp
roj]

    4054 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)
```

and:
```
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\INSTALL.vcxproj" (default target) (1) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\ALL_BUILD.vcxproj" (default target) (3) ->
"C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\shm.vcxproj" (default target) (4) ->
(ClCompile target) ->
  C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\libshm_windows\core.cpp(5): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'TH/TH.h':
No such file or directory [C:\Users\Alex\aaapy\pytorch\torch\lib\build\libshm_windows\shm.vcxproj]

    0 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)
```

and then at the end:
`
error: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: 'torch/lib/tmp_install/share/ATen/Declarations.yaml'
`


Maybe this is the cause?
```
CMake Warning:
  Manually-specified variables were not used by the project:

    ATEN_LIBRARIES
    CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE
    CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS
    CUDA_NVCC_FLAGS
    NO_CUDA
    THCS_LIBRARIES
    THCUNN_LIBRARIES
    THCUNN_SO_VERSION
    THC_LIBRARIES
    THC_SO_VERSION
    THNN_LIBRARIES
    THNN_SO_VERSION
    THS_LIBRARIES
    TH_INCLUDE_PATH
    TH_LIBRARIES
    TH_LIB_PATH
    TH_SO_VERSION
    Torch_FOUND
    cwrap_files
```
